28.heading: Biografías Secuenciales.
28.title: "Para un Diccionario de la Historieta en Cuba: Charla con Miguel Bonera Miranda"
28.author: Manolo Pérez
28.appears_in: p. 105-119 in Revista Latinoamericana de Estudios Sobre la Historieta, v. 6, no. 22 (Junio 2006).
notes: "Resumen: La entrevista resulta un primer encuentro con el investigador Agregado de la coordinación de Bibliotecas de Cultura en La Habana, Miguel Bonera, que resultara ganadorade una beca para la terminación de un Diccionario que recoge una valiosa y muy necesaria información histórica del comic en Cuba y su desarrollo a través de temas, personajes autores del cual hemos querido mostrar en el presente trabajo algunos ejemplos ilustrativos."

Abstract: Intervew from a first meeting with Miguel Bonera, researcher attached to the Coordination of Cultural Libraries in Havana, who has won a grant to complete a dictionary that collects valuable and necessary historical information about comics in Cuba and their development, through themes, characters and creators. We have shown some illustrative examples here.
Abstracts as printed with the article, with some editing of the English.

Sample entries given here are: "Abecilandia" ; "Abela (Eduardo Abela Villareal)" ; "Aborígenes en la Historieta Cubana" ; "Baconao, el Indito" ; "Bangán" ; "Barbarita" ; "Biografías Secuenciales" ; "C Linea" ; "Cacique Ariguanabo del Humor"; "Calimete" ; "Calvo (Alfredo Calvo Montalvo)" ; "Chamaco."

64.heading: BIOGRAPHICAL COMIC BOOKS, STRIPS, ETC.
64.title: Booth
64.author: written by C
64.appears_in: C. Colbert ; illustrated by Tanitoc ; color by Hilary Sycamore.
notes: Summary (from publisher web site): "In a time when brother was pitted against brother, no family was more divided than the Booths. The United States has become violently polarized. Political fanaticism divides an embittered populace. A recently elected President, an energizing symbol of change for some, and a harbinger of the downfall of America for others, stands at the center of the turmoil. It is 1865, and John Wilkes Booth is about to assassinate the President of the United States. From the pen of American historian C.C. Colbert and the brush of French comics master Tanitoc comes a thought-provoking perspective on one of the greatest villains of U.S. History: a killer who was also an actor, a lover, a doubter, and, in his own mind, a patriot."
